cycle_summaries.summary: First v2 construct-first landscape mapping cycle. Scanned 25 structural signals across 7 source categories. Graded all 25 above threshold (4/10). Clustered into 14 opportunity themes. Constructed 20 distinct business models across 13 verified opportunities. 4 Tier 1, 4 Tier 2, 5 Tier 3.

key_patterns_identified.name: PE Distress + AI Cost Collapse Double Disruption
Jevons Expansion Consistently 3-5x in Professional Services

under_explored_areas: Agriculture/AgTech AI (Davis, CA location could be an advantage)
Manufacturing quality control / supply chain AI
Robotics x AI in physical production
VC/angel capital allocation rotation signals
next_cycle_direction: Expanded scope: Add physical production/manufacturing/robotics landscape
Deep competitor analysis on Tier 1 services
Capital allocation signals from asset managers

cycle_summaries.summary: EXPANDED SCOPE cycle. Added physical production/manufacturing/robotics landscape alongside deepened services analysis. Scanned 42 signals across ALL 8 source categories (including new Category 8: Manufacturing/Robotics/Physical Production). Graded 38 above threshold. Clustered into 18 opportunity themes. Constructed 32 business models across 16 verified opportunities. 5 Tier 1, 5 Tier 2, 6 Tier 3. NEW: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition enters Tier 1 at rank 3. Physical/production landscape mapped for first time.

tier_1.name: SMB Accounting/Finance (Service Layer)
tier_1.cycle_2_change: Score -1 (tool layer crowding). Thesis SHARPENED: build at service/full-service layer, not tool layer. CA AB 1175 lowers CPA entry barrier.

tier_1.name: Healthcare Admin AI (Independent Practices)
tier_1.cycle_2_change: Score +1. CMS WISeR model = government endorsing AI in healthcare admin. HIPAA infra commoditizing. Target independent practices, not enterprise.

tier_1.name: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition
tier_1.cycle_2_change: NEW Tier 1 entry. SBA 504 fee waiver + retiring-owner acquisition + cobot modernization = viable sub-$8M physical play.

tier_1.name: Insurance Claims AI
tier_1.cycle_2_change: Score unchanged. Competitive sparsity CONFIRMED (<$20M total startup funding for $40B+ market). NAIC model law strengthens moat timeline.

tier_1.name: AI-First Legal Services (SMB)
tier_1.cycle_2_change: Score unchanged. Harvey $8B VALIDATES structural force. Counter-signal analyzed: Harvey = sustaining, SMB = disruptive. Clear differentiation.

tier_2.name: Specialty Food/Beverage Production AI + Robotics
tier_2.cycle_2_change: NEW. Acquire retiring food producer + cobot/AI modernization. USDA VAPG + SBA 504 capital stack. BEST FIT production category.

tier_2.name: PE Distress Cascade
tier_2.cycle_2_change: Score -1. Now applies to both services AND manufacturing. Distress rate 11.98% (+148%).

tier_2.name: Precision Agriculture (Davis CA)
tier_2.cycle_2_change: NEW. UC Davis Farm Robotics ecosystem. Central Valley specialty crops. Founder location advantage.

tier_2.name: AI Regulatory Compliance
tier_2.cycle_2_change: Unchanged. 250+ healthcare AI bills strengthen thesis.

tier_2.name: US-LATAM AI Services + Manufacturing
tier_2.cycle_2_change: EXPANDED from services-only. LATAM factory automation $20B+ market. Nearshoring creates demand for bilingual AI integration services.

tier_3.name: Capital Allocation Rotation (validation signal)
tier_3.cycle_2_change: NEW. Not directly investable but confirms physical plays are fundable.

tier_3.name: Skilled Trades AI Operations
tier_3.cycle_2_change: Score -4. Lower priority vs manufacturing and food production opportunities.

tier_3.name: Construction Prefab/Modular Robotics
tier_3.cycle_2_change: NEW. Over budget for direct factory. FaaS integration service possible.

key_patterns_identified.name: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence
key_patterns_identified.update: All 4 services Tier 1 continue strengthening.

key_patterns_identified.name: Demographic Gap + AI Readiness (EXPANDED to manufacturing)
key_patterns_identified.update: Silver Tsunami adds 2.34M boomer-owned businesses to demographic gap.

key_patterns_identified.name: Regulatory Fragmentation as Structural Moat (DEEPENED)
key_patterns_identified.update: CMS WISeR, HIPAA update, NAIC model law, Colorado AI Act all strengthen.

key_patterns_identified.name: PE Distress Double Disruption (BROADENED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Distress rate 11.98%. Now applies to manufacturing acquisitions too.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Robotics x AI Compound Production Cost Compression
key_patterns_identified.update: 9 independent signals. IFR data, PMI divergence, cobot adoption, 98% interest but 20% readiness.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Capital Allocation Rotation to Hard-Tech/Physical
key_patterns_identified.update: a16z $1.18B, VC robotics $6B+, BlackRock overweight industrials, JPM supercycle broadening.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Manufacturing Credit Structure Advantage (SBA 504)
key_patterns_identified.update: SBA 504 fee waiver through Sept 2026. TIME-SENSITIVE enabler.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Christensen Sustaining vs Disruptive Distinction
key_patterns_identified.update: Consistent across accounting, legal, healthcare: tool-layer competitors are sustaining, service-layer opportunity is disruptive.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Silver Tsunami Acquisition Window
key_patterns_identified.update: 2.34M businesses, $10T transfer, 58% no succession plan.

transmission_chains_status.note: 200x/year price drops. Application layer economics now deeply viable.
Tool-layer saturating, service-layer opening. Christensen distinction clear.
CMS WISeR model = government endorsement. Accelerating.
NEW chain. Installations doubling, PMI diverging, but SME adoption still early.
NEW chain. Silver Tsunami actively materializing. Assets available.
NEW chain. Asset managers allocating, VC funds forming. Downstream effects in 12-24mo.
Factory automation market growing. Reflex Robotics Mexico. Integration services needed.
Legislation proliferating rapidly. First-mover compliance advantage widening.
Digital correction, physical capital flows. Build crash-resilient.

cycle_2_key_findings.finding_1: Physical production IS viable at sub-$15M. SBA 504 fee waiver + retiring-owner acquisition at 2-4x EBITDA + cobot modernization = $3-8M total entry cost for a manufacturing play with real moats (equipment, permits, customer contracts).
cycle_2_key_findings.finding_2: The Christensen sustaining/disruptive distinction is THE competitive lens for 2026. Across accounting, legal, and healthcare, well-funded competitors are building tools for incumbents. The disruptive opportunity (AI-first service for underserved markets) remains nearly empty.
cycle_2_key_findings.finding_3: Capital allocation has decisively rotated toward hard-tech/physical. a16z American Dynamism ($1.18B), BlackRock overweight industrials, VC robotics $6B+. Physical/production AI plays are now 'sexy' for funders.
cycle_2_key_findings.finding_4: SBA 504 fee waiver for manufacturers expires Sept 30, 2026. This is a TIME-SENSITIVE enabling structure that makes FY2026 the optimal entry window for manufacturing acquisition plays.
cycle_2_key_findings.finding_5: Davis CA location advantage is REAL for precision agriculture and food production. UC Davis Farm Robotics ecosystem, Central Valley specialty crops, food production cluster. This isn't just geographic convenience -- it's a structural moat.

next_cycle_direction: Screen real acquisition targets (BizBuySell, LoopNet, broker outreach)
Model SBA 504 + equipment financing capital stacks for specific scenarios
Service-layer competitive density analysis across top 4 services opportunities
Customer discovery interviews across top opportunities
CMS WISeR model participation pathway research
UC Davis AIFS partnership exploration

cycle_summaries.summary: DEEPENING & CORRECTION cycle. Real data replaces estimates across manufacturing acquisition, food production, SBA 504, competitive density, and O*NET task classification. Scanned 38 signals including 10 counter-signals (2+ per Tier 1 opportunity). Constructed 34 business models. KEY CORRECTIONS: Legal AI DEMOTED from Tier 1 to Tier 2 (score -7, Lawhive $60M Series B closes service layer gap). Insurance Claims AI score -3 (4% scaling rate, 70% customer mistrust). Healthcare Admin AI score -2, REFRAMED to provider-side (WISeR vendor selection closed). Food/Beverage Production PROMOTED from Tier 2 to Tier 1 (score +2, confirmed with real listings and unit economics). Manufacturing Acquisition score +1, CONFIRMED with BizBuySell data and modeled capital stack. SBA 504 CORRECTED: first-time buyers need 15% down (not 10%). USDA VAPG corrected to $250K max. 2 new patterns identified: Embedded AI Commoditizing Tool Layer (P-011) and Provider-Side Healthcare AI Arms Race (P-012).

tier_1.name: SMB Accounting/Finance (Full-Service Layer)
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score -1. Service layer no longer empty (Basis, Docyt). Embedded AI in Xero/Intuit threatens tool layer. FULL-SERVICE layer remains empty. Unit economics: $0.05/month inference per client. Target: 23M unserved single-entity SMBs.

tier_1.name: Healthcare Admin AI (Provider-Side)
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score -2, REFRAMED. WISeR vendor selection CLOSED (6 vendors identified: Cohere, Genzeon, Humata, Innovaccer, Virtix, Zyter). Congressional repeal bill. PROVIDER-SIDE opportunity strengthened. Horizontal platform across ALL practice types = gap (competitors hyper-specialized). Arms race dynamic: payer AI vs provider AI.

tier_1.name: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score +1, CONFIRMED WITH REAL DATA. BizBuySell: 379 CA manufacturing for sale, median $600K. CNC shops: $1.25-3M asking, $1-2M revenue, $300-400K EBITDA. Capital stack modeled: $3M acquisition + $500K modernization, $18K/mo debt service covered by $29K/mo EBITDA. SBA 504 at 5.85%. CORRECTION: 15% equity for first-time buyers.

tier_1.name: Specialty Food/Beverage Production
tier_1.cycle_3_change: PROMOTED from Tier 2. Score +2. BizBuySell: 77 CA food production for sale. Wholesale bakery: $1.7M revenue, $500K profit, 300+ stores. Unit economics modeled: acquire at $1-1.5M, add cobots $200-300K, margin uplift from 29% to 35-45%. BEST FIT for robotics x AI. USDA VAPG corrected to $250K max.

tier_1.name: Insurance Claims AI (SMB/TPA)
tier_1.cycle_3_change: Score -3. 78% adopted but only 4% SCALED = implementation much harder. 70% customer mistrust. Hallucination liability risk. Microsoft + Cognizant deploying enterprise = squeeze from above. BUT: SMB/TPA layer (1,200+ TPAs) remains underserved. SLOWER opportunity than assumed.

tier_2.name: AI-First Legal Services (SMB Corporate Niche)
tier_2.cycle_3_change: DEMOTED from Tier 1. Score -7. Lawhive $60M Series B, $35M ARR, 7x growth, expanding to 35 US states. Service layer CLOSING. 37% SMBs already using AI for legal. Remaining niche: SMB corporate legal (contracts, employment, IP) where Lawhive doesn't focus.

tier_2.name: PE Distress Cascade
tier_2.cycle_3_change: Score -1. Tariff uncertainty scares PE = fewer competing buyers = FAVORABLE for individual acquirers. 70% M&A failure rate = key risk.

tier_2.name: AI Regulatory Compliance
tier_2.cycle_3_change: Score unchanged. Regulatory landscape continues deepening.

tier_2.name: Precision Agriculture (Davis CA)
tier_2.cycle_3_change: Score -3. OEM competition (Deere See & Spray commercial, CNH, AGCO billions R&D). Seasonal revenue. Capital intensity. Specialty crop niche valid but LONGER timeline than manufacturing.

tier_3.name: Capital Allocation Signals
tier_3.cycle_3_change: Score +2. BlackRock/JPM/Goldman ALL bullish on physical AI. Strongest consensus ever.

key_patterns_identified.name: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence
key_patterns_identified.update: O*NET validation: Bookkeepers 85-90%, Med Records 97%, Claims 65-75%, Paralegals 70% routine-cognitive. Healthcare admin deepest cure.

key_patterns_identified.name: Demographic Gap + AI Readiness (manufacturing CONFIRMED)
key_patterns_identified.update: BizBuySell: 379+77 CA businesses for sale. Real retirement-sale listings at 0.50-1.12x revenue.

key_patterns_identified.name: Regulatory Fragmentation as Moat (COUNTER-SIGNALS noted)
key_patterns_identified.update: WISeR vendor selection closed. Congressional repeal bill. But provider-side opportunity + regulatory complexity = deeper moat for compliant entrants.

key_patterns_identified.name: PE Distress (NUANCED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Tariffs scare PE = fewer competing buyers. Favorable for non-PE acquirers. 70% M&A failure rate = key risk.

key_patterns_identified.name: Jevons Expansion (unit economics CONFIRMED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Inference $0.05/month per client. 4,000x raw cost advantage. Effective 10-50x. 23M unserved SMBs.

key_patterns_identified.name: Robotics x AI Compound (UPGRADED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Upgraded from strong. Real cobot pricing, O*NET task data, BizBuySell targets, capital stack. Partial enhancement (not replacement) for physical production.

key_patterns_identified.name: Capital Allocation Rotation (UPGRADED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Upgraded from strong. BlackRock + JPM + Goldman ALL bullish. Strongest consensus ever for physical AI.

key_patterns_identified.name: SBA 504 Capital Structure (CORRECTED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Upgraded from strong. Rates 5.67-5.91%. CORRECTED: 15% down for first-time buyers. Capital stack modeled end-to-end. Fee waiver expires Sept 30, 2026.

key_patterns_identified.name: Christensen Three-Layer (DEEPENED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Upgraded from strong. Cross-sector validation complete. NEW insight: embedded AI commoditizes tool layer. Service layer emerging. Full-service layer empty.

key_patterns_identified.name: Silver Tsunami (CONFIRMED with real data)
key_patterns_identified.update: Upgraded from strong. BizBuySell listings confirm. Specific CNC shops and food producers identified.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Embedded AI Commoditizing Tool Layer
key_patterns_identified.update: Xero/Intuit, Westlaw/Lexis, EHR vendors embedding AI. Standalone tools face commoditization. Service/full-service insulated.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Provider-Side Healthcare AI Arms Race
key_patterns_identified.update: WISeR payer AI triggers demand for provider AI. AMA: 61% say AI increases denials. Provider-side aligned with physician interests.

transmission_chains_status.note: Goldman $527B capex. $0.05/month inference per client. Overhang deepening.
Tool layer saturating + embedded AI commoditization. Service layer emerging. Full-service is frontier.
WISeR reframed: provider-side. 97% med records automation. Arms race dynamic.
Advanced from N3-N4. Real data confirms. Deloitte: 50% AI adoption growth. SME deployment still early.
CONFIRMED at N5. 379+77 CA businesses for sale. Window open NOW.
Advanced. BlackRock/JPM/Goldman consensus. Downstream effects materializing.
Unchanged. Expansion market.
WISeR + NAIC + Colorado AI Act + 250+ bills. Political risk but trajectory = more regulation.
Goldman $527B confirms installation phase. Application layer = highest conviction.
NEW. Platform vendors embedding AI. Tool layer structural threat.
NEW. WISeR triggers payer AI. Demand for provider AI counter-tools.

cycle_3_key_corrections.correction_1: SBA 504 equity requirement: cycle 2 stated 10% down for all. ACTUAL: first-time buyers (businesses <2 years) need 15% down. On a $3M acquisition: $450K equity (not $300K). Still achievable but higher bar.
cycle_3_key_corrections.correction_2: USDA VAPG amount: cycle 2 stated $200K max. ACTUAL: $250K max. Requires 1:1 match.
cycle_3_key_corrections.correction_3: Legal AI service layer: cycle 2 described as 'sparse.' Lawhive $60M Series B (Feb 5, 2026) reveals service layer RAPIDLY FILLING. Triggered demotion from Tier 1 to Tier 2 (score -7).
cycle_3_key_corrections.correction_4: Healthcare admin WISeR opportunity: cycle 2 framed as entering WISeR. Research shows vendor selection CLOSED and congressional repeal bill. Reframed to PROVIDER-SIDE (helping practices fight AI-powered denials).
cycle_3_key_corrections.correction_5: Manufacturing acquisition integration timeline: cycle 2 implied 3-6 months. Real data suggests 12-18 months realistic. 70% M&A synergy failure rate.

cycle_3_key_findings.finding_1: REAL ACQUISITION DATA confirms thesis: 379 CA manufacturing businesses for sale (median $600K), 77 food production (median $377K). CNC shops at $1.25-3M asking with $300-400K EBITDA. Retirement sales cluster at 3.2-4x EBITDA. Capital stack modeled: $18K/mo debt service covered by $29K/mo pre-modernization EBITDA.
cycle_3_key_findings.finding_2: Christensen three-layer framework is THE competitive insight for 2026. NEW: embedded AI from platform vendors (Xero, Intuit, Westlaw, EHRs) is commoditizing the tool layer. Service layer emerging but still sparse (Basis, Docyt for accounting; Lawhive, Garfield for legal; HealthSpark, Verse for healthcare). Full-service layer EMPTY across all sectors.
cycle_3_key_findings.finding_3: O*NET Polanyi classification provides quantitative backing: Bookkeepers 85-90% routine-cognitive (highest services automation potential), Medical Records 97% (deepest Baumol Cure), Machinists 30% routine-cognitive + 50% tacit-manual (partial enhancement, not replacement). Physical production automation is DIFFERENT from services automation.
cycle_3_key_findings.finding_4: Counter-signals are substantive, not dismissable: Lawhive $60M killed legal Tier 1 thesis. Insurance 4% scaling rate (vs 78% adoption) = real implementation barrier. 70% M&A failure rate adds realism to manufacturing. WISeR vendor selection closed. These corrections make the remaining opportunities MORE credible.
cycle_3_key_findings.finding_5: Capital allocation consensus is the STRONGEST yet: BlackRock ('humanoid robotics most transformative frontier'), JPM (AI supercycle broadening), Goldman ($500B+ AI investment, reindustrialization). All three major asset managers are bullish on physical-economy AI. This validates manufacturing/robotics/food production plays as fundable.

Mental health / therapy AI (regulatory moat forming, Utah first law)

cycle_summaries.summary: QUANTITATIVE DEEPENING cycle. O*NET Polanyi classification across 15 occupations + BLS May 2024 wage/employment data produce the first fully quantified Baumol Cure Priority Matrix: $207B in automatable wage bill across 7 key occupations. Stress tests executed on top 3 opportunities with real competitive intelligence. 3 under-explored sectors assessed with clear verdicts. 20 signals scanned. 37 total business models (3 new for Mental Health AI, 1 new for Government AI). 2 new patterns identified (P-013 Dead Business Revival, P-014 Quantitative Baumol Matrix). 10 key unknowns resolved. 4 new barriers identified. Score adjustments: Accounting -2, Manufacturing -1, Food -1. Mental Health AI promoted to Tier 2. Government AI assessed for Tier 3. Real Estate AI dismissed (too crowded).

tier_1.name: SMB Accounting/Finance (Full-Service Layer)
tier_1.cycle_4_change: Score -2. Intuit Accountant Suite entering service layer (Feb 2026). Bench $113M collapse = P4 dead revival. BUT: Intuit serves accountants (B2B2C), not SMBs directly. Full-service direct-to-SMB remains empty. $139B automatable wage base quantified via O*NET + BLS.

tier_1.name: Healthcare Admin AI (Provider-Side)
tier_1.cycle_4_change: Score unchanged. O*NET: Medical Records 97% = highest automation potential of all screened occupations. BLS: employment growing +8.7% despite 97% automation = textbook Schumpeterian gap period. NOT YET STRESS TESTED.

tier_1.name: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition
tier_1.cycle_4_change: Score -1. STRESS TESTED: Cobot ROI proven (8-14 months). #1 kill risk = operational complexity (70% M&A failure rate), NOT cobot economics. O*NET: machinists 79% overall but manual dexterity resists = acquire-and-ENHANCE model validated.

tier_1.name: Specialty Food/Beverage Production
tier_1.cycle_4_change: Score -1. STRESS TESTED: #1 kill risk = commodity margins (5-10%) too thin for input cost volatility. CRITICAL FILTER: must target specialty/branded only (20-35% margins). FDA PCHF $22K yr1. NEW: FSMA 204 traceability + PFAS concerns = added compliance burden but also moat.

tier_1.name: Insurance Claims AI (SMB/TPA)
tier_1.cycle_4_change: Score unchanged. O*NET: Claims Adjusters 63% (judgment resists), Insurance Sales 80% (routine). Combined $36B automatable wage base. NOT YET STRESS TESTED.

tier_2.name: Mental Health AI (Sub-Clinical/Productivity)
tier_2.cycle_4_change: NEW ENTRY. PROMOTED from monitoring. Woebot $123M dead = P4 dead revival. FDA pathway blocked BUT sub-clinical + therapist tools viable. Utah HB 452 = regulatory moat forming. 75% county shortage = massive Jevons (5-10x at $10-30/mo). MindSync $720M shows market.

tier_2.name: AI Regulatory Compliance
tier_2.cycle_4_change: Unchanged. Utah mental health AI regulation expands compliance domain.

tier_2.name: AI-First Legal Services (SMB Corporate)
tier_2.cycle_4_change: Unchanged. O*NET confirms: Paralegals 90% automatable ($20B), Lawyers 23% judgment-premium ($82B). AGG prediction-judgment split validated.

tier_3.name: Government/Municipal AI
tier_3.cycle_4_change: NEW: ASSESSED from monitoring. $26B market, 82% state CIOs using GenAI. BUT: 12-24mo procurement cycles, Tyler Technologies $1.8B, FedRAMP barrier. NOT promoted beyond Tier 3.

dismissed.name: Real Estate Transaction AI
dismissed.reason: EXTREMELY crowded. $10.5B funding 2025. 7 unicorns. EliseAI $2.25B. Not viable for new entry.

key_patterns_identified.name: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence
key_patterns_identified.update: QUANTIFIED: $207B automatable wage bill via O*NET + BLS cross-reference. Bookkeepers + Accountants = $139B. Baumol stored energy STILL GROWING (professional services wages +4%/yr vs CPI ~2.5%).

key_patterns_identified.update: BLS projections: bookkeepers -5%, claims adjusters -5% = pre-cascade employment decline. CA AB 1175 signed Oct 2025, effective Jan 2027.

key_patterns_identified.update: NEW DIMENSION: Mental health AI regulation (Utah HB 452). CPA licensing modernizing (CA AB 1175). Moat expanding to new sectors.

key_patterns_identified.update: Bench 35K customers = proven demand. 23M unserved SMBs. 75% county mental health shortage. Jevons expansion PROVEN across sectors.

key_patterns_identified.name: Robotics x AI Compound (STRESS TESTED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Cobot ROI 8-14 months, $65-85K/yr savings. 35% adoption surge. Skills gap (not cost) is new constraint. Partial enhancement model validated by O*NET.

key_patterns_identified.update: Unchanged.

key_patterns_identified.update: CRITICAL: Intuit Accountant Suite = platform incumbent moving to service layer (Feb 2026). Bench collapse = dead revival at full-service. Service layer competition INCREASING. Full-service remains frontier.

Ranking: Accountants $75B, Bookkeepers $64B, Insurance Sales $22B, Paralegals $20B, Claims Adjusters $14B, Medical Records $9B, Tax Preparers $4B. Total: $207B. PREMIUM side: RNs $247B, Lawyers $82B.

cycle_4_key_findings.finding_1: BAUMOL CURE PRIORITY MATRIX: First quantitative framework for ranking opportunities by total automatable wage bill. O*NET automation risk x BLS wages x employment = $207B across 7 key occupations. This is not an estimate -- it's calculated from government occupational and labor data. Accounting ($139B combined bookkeepers + accountants) is the largest automatable pool. Healthcare admin (medical records 97%) has the deepest automation potential but smaller employment base.
cycle_4_key_findings.finding_2: STRESS TESTS SURVIVED WITH ADJUSTMENTS: All top 3 survived stress testing. (1) SMB Accounting: Intuit Accountant Suite is the biggest threat but serves accountants (B2B2C), not SMBs directly. Bench $113M collapse validates market while proving AI+human hybrid fails -- pure AI solves it. Score -2 but thesis intact. (2) Manufacturing: Cobot ROI is PROVEN (8-14 months, $65-85K/yr). The kill risk is operational complexity (70% M&A failure), not technology. Score -1 but acquire-and-enhance model validated. (3) Food: Commodity margins (5-10%) are NOT viable. MUST filter for specialty/branded (20-35%). Score -1 with critical filter added.
cycle_4_key_findings.finding_3: DEAD BUSINESS REVIVAL IS A CROSS-SECTOR PATTERN: Bench ($113M, accounting) and Woebot ($123M, mental health) both collapsed with validated markets. Combined $236M in proved demand. Failure modes are DIFFERENT but both SOLVABLE: Bench's cost structure fails at AI+human hybrid but works at pure AI ($0.05/month). Woebot's regulatory path fails via FDA but works via sub-clinical. This is P4 (Dead Business Revival) operating at scale -- the richest vein of validated opportunity.
cycle_4_key_findings.finding_4: UNDER-EXPLORED SECTOR VERDICTS: Mental Health AI PROMOTED to Tier 2 (score 74) -- massive Jevons expansion (5-10x at $10-30/mo), P4 dead revival (Woebot $123M), regulatory moat forming (Utah HB 452), 3 viable sub-FDA paths. Government/Municipal AI placed at Tier 3 (score 67) -- strong Baumol force but 12-24mo procurement cycles kill startup runway. Real Estate Transaction AI DISMISSED entirely -- $10.5B funding, 7 unicorns, no entry point.
cycle_4_key_findings.finding_5: O*NET POLANYI CLASSIFICATION REVEALS THE AUTOMATE-AUGMENT SPLIT: High-automation occupations (bookkeepers 91%, tax preparers 99%, medical records 97%, paralegals 90%) are dominated by routine-cognitive tasks = AUTOMATE. Low-automation occupations (RNs 10%, lawyers 23%) have strong tacit-cognitive/interpersonal components = AUGMENT/PREMIUM. Medium automation (claims adjusters 63%, machinists 79%) require human-in-the-loop. This split is actionable: build full automation for the first group, productivity tools for the second, hybrid for the third.

key_unknowns_resolved: O*NET automation exposure: Full quantitative screen across 15 occupations (Bookkeepers 91%, Tax Preparers 99%, Accountants 67%, Medical Records 97%, Paralegals 90%, Claims Adjusters 63%, Insurance Sales 80%, Machinists 79%, RNs 10%, Lawyers 23%)
BLS wages x automation cross-reference: $207B total automatable wage bill calculated
Bench Accounting failure mode: Collapsed Dec 2024, $113M raised, 35K customers, AI+offshore human cost structure failed
Intuit competitive positioning: Accountant Suite replacing QBO Accountant (Feb 2026), AI-native, serves accountants not SMBs directly
Cobot ROI: 8-14 months payback, 35% adoption surge 2024, $65-85K/yr per cobot savings
FDA compliance cost for food: PCHF $22K year 1, $8K/yr ongoing, FSMA 204 traceability new 2026
Mental health AI landscape: Woebot dead ($123M), MindSync $720M, Utah HB 452 first state regulation
Real estate AI density: $10.5B funding, 7 unicorns -- too crowded
Government AI assessment: $26B market but 12-24mo procurement, Tyler Technologies $1.8B incumbent
CA AB 1175 CPA licensing: Signed Oct 2025, effective Jan 2027, lowers barrier

Specific acquisition target shortlisting (narrow BizBuySell to 5-10 actionable targets)
SBA 504 CDC relationship establishment

Intuit Accountant Suite full roadmap (will they offer direct-to-SMB full-service?)
Mental health AI state regulation tracker (which states following Utah?)

EHR integration landscape (which 10-20 EHRs cover 80% of independent practices?)
Insurance TPA licensing requirements by state

PRIORITY 2: Narrow BizBuySell acquisition targets to 5-10 specific listings

cycle_summaries.summary: BUSINESS MODEL DECOMPOSITION cycle — YC-granularity. Decomposed all 11 sectors (5 Tier 1, 6 Tier 2) into 102 specific, buildable business models. Each model scored INDEPENDENTLY on 5 new axes: competitive_density (inverted), unit_economics_clarity, distribution_specificity, moat_durability, customer_findability. Web search executed for ACTUAL competitors on each specific model. Top models cluster around 3 themes: (1) Dead Business Revival plays targeting orphaned customers (Bench bookkeeping #1 at score 80), (2) Acquire-and-Modernize physical businesses (CNC shop #2 at 80, bakery #4 at 77), (3) Underserved niche services within competitive sectors (restaurant bookkeeping 75, dental billing 72, PT denial prevention 73, US-LATAM tax 74). Tool-layer plays scored lowest due to competitive density. 5 models explicitly NOT recommended due to incumbent saturation. New pattern P-015 identified: Niche Segmentation Reveals Hidden Opportunity Structure. Christensen three-layer framework quantitatively validated — full-service models score highest, tool-layer models score lowest.

top_5_models.name: AI Bookkeeping for Orphaned Bench Customers
top_5_models.key_insight: 35K known customers with proven willingness to pay. Dead business revival = highest-scoring pattern. 90% gross margin at $149/mo.

top_5_models.name: Acquire-and-Modernize CA CNC Shop
top_5_models.key_insight: Very low competition at sub-$3M scale (PE targets larger). Physical moat (assets, permits, contracts). SBA 504 fee waiver active.

top_5_models.name: Acquire-and-Modernize CA Wholesale Bakery
top_5_models.key_insight: FDA/USDA certifications + distribution + brand = strong moat. Must target specialty/branded only (20-35% margins). FSMA 204 adds compliance moat.

top_5_models.name: AI Prior Auth Appeals for Independent Practices
top_5_models.key_insight: WISeR launching Jan 2026 creates urgency. Enterprise competitors don't serve independent practices. $1K-3K/mo per practice revenue.

top_5_models.name: AI Bookkeeping for Restaurants/Food Trucks
top_5_models.key_insight: 1M+ restaurants in US, 90% independent. Restaurant365 targets chains. POS marketplace (Toast, Square) provides distribution. Davis CA local access.

not_recommended.name: AI Sub-Clinical Wellness Consumer App
not_recommended.reason: Calm, Headspace, BetterHelp too dominant. Woebot dead validates difficulty.

not_recommended.name: AI Tax for Gig Workers
not_recommended.reason: FlyFin ($15M) and Keeper ($42M) direct, well-funded competitors

not_recommended.name: AI Clinical Documentation for PCPs
not_recommended.reason: Abridge ($250M), DeepScribe, Nuance DAX too dominant

scoring_methodology.note: Scored per specific model, NOT inherited from sector. Web search for ACTUAL competitors executed per model.

key_competitive_findings.finding: Finaloop ($35M) directly competes in e-commerce bookkeeping -- reduces D5-ACC-02 score. Shopify e-commerce bookkeeping is NOT an open field.
Avallon (YC S25, $4.6M) directly competes in workers' comp claims AI with CA TPA customers already -- reduces D5-INS-01 score to 68.
Archy ($20M Series B) growing 300% YoY in dental practice management -- adjacent to D5-HC-02 but targeting DSOs, not solo practices.
Blueprint ($27M, 50K clinicians) dominates therapist documentation -- reduces D5-MH-01 to 66. Tool-layer therapist notes becoming commodity.
NO funded AI-first US-LATAM tax startup found -- D5-ACC-08 scores 74 with highest competitive_density score (85) in the decomposition.
General Catalyst ($750M Creation Strategy) targets $100M+ EBITDA rollups -- validates thesis but operates at entirely different scale from D5-MFG-01.
Standard Bots ($63M) is a cobot PROVIDER, not acquirer -- potential partner for D5-MFG-01 and D5-MFG-02.
Apixio ($105M) directly competes in medical records/chart abstraction -- reduces D5-HC-03 to 61. Enterprise healthcare AI is crowded.

key_patterns_identified.name: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence
key_patterns_identified.update: Accounting sector alone produces 10+ viable specific models. $139B automatable wage base supports multiple independent businesses through niche segmentation.

key_patterns_identified.name: Demographic Gap + AI Readiness
key_patterns_identified.update: Manufacturing acquisition models (D5-MFG-01, D5-FOOD-01) score highest among physical plays precisely because Silver Tsunami creates acquisition supply.

key_patterns_identified.name: Regulatory Fragmentation as Moat
key_patterns_identified.update: Regulatory compliance itself decomposes into multiple businesses: healthcare AI (D5-REG-01), hiring AI (D5-REG-02), NAIC insurance (D5-INS-03), mental health state regulation.

key_patterns_identified.name: Jevons Expansion (Bench revival)
key_patterns_identified.update: Bench orphans (D5-ACC-01) are the most specific Jevons signal: 35K customers who PROVED willingness to pay, available for re-acquisition at low CAC.

key_patterns_identified.name: Robotics x AI Compound
key_patterns_identified.update: Decomposes into 6 distinct plays: acquire-modernize, integration service, scheduling SaaS, quoting tool, QC vision, multi-shop rollup.

key_patterns_identified.name: Christensen Three-Layer (QUANTITATIVELY VALIDATED)
key_patterns_identified.update: Full-service models (D5-ACC-01 at 80, D5-MFG-01 at 80) score highest. Service-layer models (D5-HC-01 at 75) score medium. Tool-layer models (D5-MH-01 at 66, D5-ACC-04 at 62) score lowest. The framework is now validated with specific numbers.

key_patterns_identified.name: Dead Business Revival (UPGRADED to very_strong)
key_patterns_identified.update: Bench orphan play (D5-ACC-01) scores #1 in the entire decomposition. Dead business revival is the single most actionable pattern.

key_patterns_identified.name: NEW: Niche Segmentation Reveals Hidden Opportunity Structure
key_patterns_identified.update: First observed. The best opportunities are in UNDERSERVED NICHES of competitive sectors. SMB accounting overall is competitive, but restaurant bookkeeping, agency bookkeeping, and US-LATAM tax are underserved. Healthcare admin is competitive at enterprise but dental billing and PT denial prevention are underserved.

transmission_chains_status.note: Decomposition confirms: $0.05/month inference enables 90%+ gross margins across ALL software models.
Decomposition reveals: cascade is niche-specific. Some niches (e-commerce bookkeeping) already have well-funded competitors. Others (restaurant bookkeeping, agency bookkeeping) do not.
Provider-side prior auth (D5-HC-01) and dental billing (D5-HC-02) are the specific transmission endpoints with best entry points.
Decomposes into acquisition plays (N5) and software/services (N3-N4). Acquisition plays are further along the chain.
BizBuySell data + specific models (D5-MFG-01, D5-FOOD-01) confirm window is open NOW.
D5-ACC-01 is the most actionable endpoint: specific customers, specific channel, specific pricing.
NEW. As sectors saturate at sector-level, opportunity cascades down into underserved niches. This is an ongoing dynamic.

cycle_5_key_findings.finding_1: DECOMPOSITION CHANGES THE MAP: Sector-level scoring (cycles 1-4) and model-level scoring (cycle 5) produce DIFFERENT rankings. SMB Accounting scored #1 as a sector but its best specific model (Bench orphans, 80) ties with manufacturing acquisition (80). Healthcare Admin scored #2 as a sector but its best specific model (prior auth, 75) ranks #4. The niche matters more than the sector.
cycle_5_key_findings.finding_2: THREE CLUSTERS EMERGE at the top: (1) Dead business revival (D5-ACC-01: Bench orphans), (2) Physical acquisition-and-modernization (D5-MFG-01: CNC, D5-FOOD-01: bakery), (3) Underserved niche services (D5-ACC-03: restaurants, D5-HC-01: prior auth, D5-ACC-08: US-LATAM tax). These are fundamentally different business types requiring different skills, capital, and timelines.
cycle_5_key_findings.finding_3: CHRISTENSEN FRAMEWORK VALIDATED QUANTITATIVELY: Tool-layer businesses average score 55-66 (too competitive). Service-layer businesses average 71-73. Full-service businesses average 75-80. The data confirms: build at the full-service layer or don't build at all.
cycle_5_key_findings.finding_4: COMPETITIVE DENSITY IS THE BIGGEST DISCRIMINATOR: Among the 5 scoring axes, competitive_density has the widest variance across models (35-85). Models with score 35-50 on competitive density are NOT recommended regardless of other factors (they score 55-63 overall). The single most important question for any model is: who else is doing exactly this?
cycle_5_key_findings.finding_5: NICHE SEGMENTATION IS THE META-PATTERN: Decomposing sectors into niches reveals that 'SMB accounting' is not one market -- it's 10+ distinct markets (e-commerce, restaurants, agencies, freelancers, LATAM, PE portfolios, construction, etc.) with DIFFERENT competitive landscapes. The implication: any sector-level conclusion from cycles 1-4 was premature. The real map is at the niche level.

key_unknowns_resolved: Competitive landscape at model level: 15+ web searches identified ACTUAL competitors for each specific model
Finaloop ($35M) status as direct e-commerce bookkeeping competitor
Avallon (YC S25) status as direct workers' comp claims AI competitor with CA TPA customers
Archy ($20M Series B) growth rate (300% YoY) in dental practice management
Blueprint ($27M) market position (50K clinicians) in therapist documentation
Absence of funded AI-first US-LATAM tax startup (competitive gap confirmed)
General Catalyst Creation Strategy scope ($750M for $100M+ EBITDA, not competing at sub-$3M level)
Standard Bots ($63M) positioning as cobot provider (potential partner, not competitor)
Model-level scoring vs sector-level scoring produces different priority rankings
key_unknowns_remaining: Customer discovery interviews -- STILL TOP PRIORITY (no actual customer conversations in any cycle)
Bench orphaned customer reachability -- can 35K be identified and contacted? Channels?
Restaurant POS integration (Toast/Square) -- marketplace requirements and costs
WISeR pilot state prior auth denial data -- how much are denials increasing?
Dental billing pain quantification -- % revenue lost to denials, current billing costs
BizBuySell specific CNC/bakery target shortlisting (narrow to 5-10)
US-LATAM cross-border tax market sizing (how many of 150K+ businesses need this?)
FSMA 204 compliance gap (how many food producers NOT compliant? Deadline pressure?)
Prototype specification for top model (D5-ACC-01 or D5-MFG-01)
Unit economics validation through real customer conversations
next_cycle_direction: PRIORITY 1: Customer discovery interviews -- 3-5 conversations per top 5 models (15-25 total conversations)
PRIORITY 2: Prototype specification for D5-ACC-01 (Bench orphan bookkeeping) -- the #1 scoring model with most specific customer target
PRIORITY 3: Bench orphan customer list building -- scrape Reddit, Twitter, Facebook for identifiable former Bench customers
PRIORITY 4: BizBuySell target shortlisting for D5-MFG-01 and D5-FOOD-01 (narrow to 5-10 specific listings with criteria)
PRIORITY 5: Toast/Square POS integration pilot requirements for D5-ACC-03 (restaurant bookkeeping)
PRIORITY 6: Prior auth denial data collection from practices in WISeR pilot states (AZ, NJ, OH, OK, TX, WA)

notes: v2 engine. Previous 11 cycles ran v1 (prosecutorial filtering). v2 uses construct-first landscape mapping. Cycle numbering restarts at 1. Cycle 2 expanded scope to include physical production/manufacturing/robotics. Cycle 3 was the first CORRECTION cycle: real data replaces estimates, counter-signals treated equally, scores moved both up and down. Cycle 4 is the QUANTITATIVE DEEPENING cycle: O*NET + BLS data replaces qualitative automation estimates with government data, stress tests on top 3 with real competitive intelligence, 3 under-explored sectors assessed with verdicts. Cycle 5 is the BUSINESS MODEL DECOMPOSITION cycle: 11 sectors decomposed into 102 specific models at YC-application granularity, each scored independently with web-searched competitor data.
